head.title: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

hedline.hl1: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week included today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.
According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 5.97 percent, and the rate on the six-month issue was 5.95 percent.
In when-issued trading, the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.03 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Greenpoint Bank, $200 million of 10-year subordinated debt, Baa3/BBB-/---. Chase Securities and Lehman Brothers.
M & T Bank, $350 million of subordinated notes due in 2010, A3/BBB+/---. Lehman Brothers and Salomon Smith Barney.
UBS Preferred Funding Trust I, $1.25 billion of noncumulative perpetual step-up preferred securities, Aa2/AA-/---. UBS Warburg.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
MONDAY
Shelby County, Tenn., $150 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TUESDAY
Florida, $100 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Guilford County, N.C., $84.8 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Pinellas County, Fla., $158.1 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Anchorage Schools, $77.9 million of general obligation bonds. Prudential Securities.
Arizona Transportation Department, $115 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Broomfield, Colo., $65.8 million of debt securities. Dain Rauscher Inc.
Louisiana Housing Finance Authority, $65 million of debt securities. George K. Baum & Co.
Miami-Dade County School District, $108 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Puerto Rico Infrastructure Finance Authority, $1.03 billion of debt securities. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
